[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/lib.rs] [Module: lib] [Filter coordination failure] Can inconsistencies between transaction, batch, and block filters allow malicious transactions to slip through one filter layer while being caught by others? (High)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Module: transaction_filter] [Governance-controlled filter updates] Can governance proposals inject malicious filter rules that allow specific attacks or censor legitimate transactions? (High)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/batch_transaction_filter.rs] [Module: batch_transaction_filter] [Validator set filter inconsistency] Can different validators have inconsistent batch filter configurations leading to consensus failures? (High)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/block_transaction_filter.rs] [Module: block_transaction_filter] [Block timestamp trust] Do block filters trust block timestamps provided by potentially Byzantine proposers without external validation? (High)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: allows_transaction()] [Censorship attack] Can a colluding group of validators use coordinated Deny rules to censor transactions from specific users or contracts? (High)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: filter_transactions()] [Front-running via selective filtering] Can validators use filters to delay victim transactions while allowing their own front-running transactions through? (High)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/batch_transaction_filter.rs] [Function: allows_transaction()] [Batch reordering attack] Can validators reorder transactions within batches after filtering to execute them in a different order than filtered? (Medium)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/block_transaction_filter.rs] [Function: allows_transaction()] [MEV extraction via filtering] Can block proposers use epoch/timestamp filters to selectively include high-value transactions for MEV extraction? (Medium)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_entry_function()] [Smart contract upgrade bypass] Can malicious contract upgrades bypass entry function filters by changing module names or function names slightly? (High)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_sender_address()] [Sybil attack via address rotation] Can an attacker evade Sender filters by rotating through fresh addresses for each malicious transaction? (Medium)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/batch_transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_batch_author()] [Validator key rotation bypass] Can validators rotate their PeerIds to bypass batch author filtering during key rotation events? (Medium)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/block_transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_block_author()] [Leader rotation exploit] Can malicious validators time their attacks to coincide with specific block authors to bypass author-based filters? (Medium)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: allows_transaction()] [Empty transaction batch] What happens when filter_transactions() is called with an empty Vec - does it maintain correct semantics? (Low)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: TransactionRule::matches()] [Rule with single matcher] Can rules with a single matcher behave differently than rules with multiple matchers in edge cases? (Low)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/batch_transaction_filter.rs] [Function: filter_batch_transactions()] [Zero-transaction batch] Can batches with zero transactions bypass batch filtering entirely? (Low)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/block_transaction_filter.rs] [Function: allows_transaction()] [Genesis block special case] Are genesis blocks (epoch 0, timestamp 0) handled correctly by epoch and timestamp filters? (Low)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/block_transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_epoch_greater_than()] [Maximum epoch value] Can epoch values at u64::MAX cause unexpected behavior in greater-than comparisons? (Low)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/block_transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_timestamp_less_than()] [Minimum timestamp value] Can timestamp values at 0 cause unexpected behavior in less-than comparisons? (Low)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: compare_script_argument_address()] [Empty script arguments] Can scripts with empty argument vectors bypass script argument address filtering? (Low)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_transaction_authenticator_address()] [Empty secondary signers] Can MultiAgent/FeePayer transactions with empty secondary signer lists bypass address filtering? (Low)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: TransactionMatcher::matches()] [Transaction hash collision] Can two different transactions produce the same committed_hash() to bypass TransactionId filters? (Critical)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/batch_transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_batch_digest()] [Batch digest preimage attack] Can an attacker find batch content that produces a specific digest to bypass digest-based filtering? (High)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/block_transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_block_id()] [Block ID collision attack] Can attackers generate blocks with colliding HashValue IDs to bypass block-specific filters? (High)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: compare_ed25519_public_key()] [Public key equality bypass] Can subtle differences in Ed25519 public key representation bypass equality checks? (Low)
